title: What is the basis of esoteric knowledge and how does it pertain to personal responsibility and the natural laws of cause and effect?
first_phrase: In this final section, the author takes a philosophical stance on esotericism and its relationship with the law of cause and effect. They stress the importance of treating oneself as a responsible being who can make their own decisions without being limited by fear or dictates. The author highlights the idea that individuals can act based on their own judgment and are accountable for the consequences of their actions. The esotericist sees all beings and their actions without moral judgment, recognizing that the sphere of morality is simply a part of the natural world, governed by the same impersonal laws.

last_phrase: "Only by recognizing and embracing the impersonal nature of natural laws can one see clearly and treat individuals as adults, respecting their freedom and autonomy. An esotericist will always honor the sphere of others' freedom, regardless of how it's used, once responsibility has been assumed. Similarly, they will refrain from imposing moral precepts and values, instead adhering to the principle of moral neutrality."
